main event: Five observers reported seeing a bright cylindrical object in the sky on May 7, 1957, tracked by radar in Cleveland, Ohio.
interesting points: The object was tracked on radar at an estimated speed exceeding 1,000 mph., The object executed abrupt turns and maneuvers, disappearing and reappearing during observation., The object was metallic and cylindrical in appearance., Radar operators were unable to obtain a lock on the object but tracked its general path., No definitive conclusions were drawn, and the case was classified as 'UNKNOWN.'
witness description: observers who tracked the object using radar
